title: 'Jeopardy!' host Alex Trebek releases pancreatic cancer PSA: 'I wished I had known sooner'
text:
CLOSE Alex Trebek had some good news to share with his fans. GeoBeats

Alex Trebek is raising awareness about pancreatic cancer and its warning signs in a new PSA.

The "Jeopardy!" host, 79, has been battling Stage 4 pancreatic cancer himself. He announced his diagnosis in March.

In the PSA, posted to the World Pancreatic Cancer Day YouTube page, Trebek talks about his own experience with cancer symptoms.

“I wished I had known sooner that the persistent stomach pain I experienced prior to my diagnosis was a symptom of pancreatic cancer,” Trebek says in the clip before listing other common symptoms: “Mid-back pain, unexplained weight loss, new onset diabetes and the yellowing of the skin or eyes.”

He added that he decided to teams up with the World Pancreatic Cancer Coalition for the PSA because "more attention and awareness are needed" to help patients "fight and survive this disease."

He also encouraged listeners to "participate in this fight" by wearing purple this November and "spreading the word on social media." World Pancreatic Cancer Day is Nov. 21.

Trebek has been open about his battle with cancer, telling ABC’s “Good Morning America” in September how chemotherapy has "different effects" on him.

"Occasionally it will cause excruciating pain in my lower back, other times it's fatigue, other times it's nausea," he said. "Cancer is mysterious in more ways than one."

Despite the effects the treatment has on him, he said he finds optimism in the fact that he's "still here."

"I don't feel terrible," he said, but admitted he's "still a bit of a wuss" at times.

"There are moments that for no reason at all I feel this surge of sadness, depression," he explained. "It doesn't last very long, but it just takes over my whole being for a short period of time. And I understand it more now, so I can deal with it a lot better than I did before."

'I'm not afraid of dying': 'Jeopardy!' host Alex Trebek opens up about cancer diagnosis
